main event: A bright, white light was observed above the horizon to the east-northeast in Wichita Falls, Texas on January 10, 1961, lasting approximately 60 minutes.
interesting points: The object appeared stationary and did not have any strobe or flashing lights., The weather was clear at the time of the observation., The sighting was consistent with a star or planet, but its exact nature could not be confirmed., The sighting lasted for about 60 minutes without any visible movement of the object., There was no sound associated with the object.
witness description: The witness was a trained police officer who observed the object through binoculars.
